story: NewsBrexit deal COULD pass as  Labour MPs prepared to vote with Theresa MayThe Prime Minister had feared defeat after Tory rebels warned  members of her own party were prepared to vote against her in ParliamentShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  OCT NewsCould Theresa May end up dancing down the aisles after all  "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTheresa May has been given fresh hope of her Brexit deal surviving after it emerged up to  Labour MPs could back her in a showdown vote. The Prime Minister had feared defeat after Tory rebels warned  members of her own party were prepared to vote against her in Parliament.If Labour votes against the deal too - which Jeremy Corbyn has said is likely - that could defeat it and send the government and Brexit into a chaotic spiral.Mr Corbyn has argued this situation would trigger the fall of the government - and a new general eleciton. But today it is being reported that a large number of Labour MPs, many in Leave-backing seats, are still uneasy about voting the deal down.  That is because of fears Mrs May could simply use a defeat to push ahead with a No Deal Brexit - the hardest possible outcome of all. If  Labour MPs back the deal, that could give Mrs May enough cover in Parliament to pass the crunch vote and survive as Prime Minister. One Labour MP told The Times: We are getting into very dangerous territory on no-deal.We will own it as much as Jacob Rees-Moggwe ultimately vote it down.Most people’s instinct is to be a loyalist but I think about this all the time. It’s bloody dficult. I’ve never broken a whip, but we’re getting to that point.  The reports come despite Labour MPs furiously rejecting Mrs Mays public appeal for unity around a moderate Brexit on the weekend.According to The Times, rebels will say the Brexit motion passed at Labour’s conference in Liverpool last month commited the party to avoiding no deal.“People can say we’ve had a go. We’ve tried to force an election and so on, one MP told the newspaper. But there is not a majority in the House of Commons when push comes to shove for a no-deal Brexit. It comes as EU and UK negotiators try to trash out a deal behind closed doors in a frantic final week of talks before next weeks European Council Summit. Theresa May will fly to Brussels next Wednesday in a bid to secure both a orce deal - the Withdrawal Agreement - and a political declaration on future trade.  Any deal will then come to a vote in Parliament, likely in mid-November. Downing Street drew a line in the sand this week by warning that declaration must be precise. Otherwise, Tory Brexiteers - who are fuming at the prospect of an imminent compromise - will mass against the deal. They are already furious that Mrs May is waiting until the last moment to reveal an alternative to her Chequers plan for customs and Northern Ireland - which the EU branded unworkable. Reports today suggest she will only put the new plan to the Cabinet at its next regular meeting next Tuesday - one day before she flies out. One worried Tory told The Times: Will they do a Chequers and say back it or f*** off

title: universal credit cruel far beyond
story: NewsopinionUniversal Credit is cruel far beyond austerity - and its becoming Theresa Mays Poll Tax, says Gordon BrownThe former Labour Prime Minister has called for a stop to Universal Credit to help reverse the current rocketing levels of UK child povertyShareCommentsByGordon Brown:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsopinionGordon Brown has denounced plans for Universal Credit - calling it cruel and vindictive "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIt is now time to abandon the national roll out of the disastrous benefit-cutting Universal Credit . Call a halt to this experiment - cruel and vindictive far beyond austerity - that is pushing child poverty among millions of hard-working British families to record levels. From next July when three million more families begin to be herded on to Universal Credit, our country will face the kind of chaos we have not seen since the days of the hated Poll Tax. With the convulsions of Brexit in March and the Universal Credit four months later we face a summer of ision and despair. From July each family on tax credits today will have to submit a wholly new form for Universal Credit – a policy Ministers have been warned will risk a breakdown in the system. Instead the Government should order a review into what is going wrong – and give emergency help to those families now in despair because of benefit cuts. With child poverty rising inexorably from three million in  to four million now and to more than five million by , October  should bring a Budget for children. And to halt the rising epidemic, Child Benefit should be raised and child tax credits should be improved - as the one way, alongside a decent living wage, that we can get low-paid families out of poverty.  Today’s poverty explodes the myth that children are in poverty because their parents are work-shy and indolent. Two thirds of the children in poverty have a parent in work - but earning too little to lt them out of poverty. In fact, nearly half - % - of households are in poverty where there is one breadwinner only in work and no other adult working. The majority of the rest who are in poverty have disability in the family. Savage Cuts are pushing them on to the breadline. And after freezing Child Benefit and children’s tax credits for years Universal Credit is taking pound-billion out of the social security budget as it is introduced. Almost .-million working families will, according to the Resolution Foundation, stand to lose an average of pound a week.  For poor people the safety net is becoming not the welfare state - it is instead becoming food banks and charities. We have seen what has happened in the Highlands where Universal Credit was first introduced. The UK Government has been asked to reimburse the local authority for the big increase in council rent arrears. Right now, in my own home area food banks are running out of food as requests for help double as a result of Universal Credit. Charities struggle to cope when giros which used to run out a few days before the next one now run out after a few days into the last one. Having served  years in public le I am now seeing poverty and hardship that I never thought I would witness and that I honestly thought we had escaped from for ever decades ago. Recently I have visited families that don’t have a cooker - and that means no hot food for the children. I have seen over the summer, when schools were out, girls and boys going for a whole day without a square meal – with charities struggling to improvise breakfast clubs and lunch clubs. I have met parents who, no matter how many hours they work, cannot put enough food on the table for their children after they’ve paid the rent the heating and for other basic essentials. The fact is that there is now more child poverty than under Margaret Thatcher and John Major. The income ide between rich and poor is bigger than in living memory. SIGN THE PETITION  Theresa May says her mission is to address burning injustice. Well the greatest burning injustice of all time is children going to school ill-clad and hungry. It is the poverty of the innocent – of children far too young to know they are not to blame. But the Government have lit the torch of this burning injustice and they have fanned the flames, with their pound-billion of cuts. Ato poll tax style chaos in a summer of discontent lies ahead...more rent arrears, more dependence on food banks and endless real-le stories of the infirm driven into desolation. As one of the architects of tax credits I remind people It was dficult enough to introduce tax credits even when we were spending billions more. But to impose universal credit and to force three million to reapply for their benefits next year when on top of a child benefits freeze they’re spending pound-billion less is chaotic, cruel and vindictive far beyond austerity.  So I am calling today for the Government to abandon the  national roll out of Universal Credit and end this harsh, harmful and hated experiment. We need an urgent review on the lines suggested by the Child Poverty Action Group to be instigated and we must hear the voices of those who know what it’s like to have help cut short I join iniduals and organisations who have called for a rethink including The Archbishop of Canterbury, The Church of Scotland, The Mayor of London, Disabled Against The Cuts, The Mayor of Liverpool, Mind, The Trussell Trust, Unison, Unite and Citizens Advice Bureau as well as the Child Poverty Action Group and most disabled charities. The review should look closely at three options: redesign Universal Credit to make it fit for purpose axing it in favour of reverting to the old systemUC is unfixable or introduce a brand new system altogether. And many good people have plenty of ideas about how this could be done Yes, right now, the issue of Brexit - our exit from Europe - is critical to our country. But millions of our fellow citizens are facing an equally big nightmare - anxious and insecure because they have no exit from poverty. Sign our petition to stop the rollout of Universal Credit across Britain and to replace it with a fairer system: https:www.change.org p theresa-may-mp-stop-the-rollout-of-universal-credit-and-replace-it-with-a-fairer-system

title: beast burford returned terrified pensioners
story: NewsFears Beast of Burford has ed after terried pensioners spot two black panthers in British countrysideThe couple were left shaking after their encounter with the creatures and say what they saw was "unmistakable"ShareCommentsByJim Hardy:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsA couple say they spotted two of the jet black creatures"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe dreaded Beast of Burford may have made a comeback after terried pensioners spotted two black panthers  in the British countryside. Canal boat enthusiast Michael Grainger and his we were still shaking days after their encounter with the creatures. The couple, from Colchester, were on holiday and sailing on the River Thames in Oxfordshire when they claim they saw the animals last Thursday morning. Huge black panther-like beasts have been sighted in Oxfordshire for decades and theyre thought to be breeding in the countryside. The legend of the Beast of Burford came after one was sighted opposite the Masons Arms pub in Burford Road, Brize Norton, in . It led to the nearby Cotswold Wildle Park offering a reward for its capture but it was never found. A photograph of the panther still adorns the wall of the pub. Describing the terrying sight for the first time today, Michael, , said the two creatures were lolling in a field beside the river.  There was one sitting on its hind legs in the field when another came out of the woods and started nuzzling it, Michael said. They were both jet black and bigger than a Labrador. I got my binoculars and watched them before they wandered off into the trees. I have good eyesight and they were no more than  metres away. I know what I saw - it was unmistakable. The couple spend their summers on a narrowboat and were sailing on the Thames at Culham Lock, Oxfordshire when they saw the two panthers. Michael said Weve never seen anything like it in the  years weve spent on the water. Further sightings of the panther been reported across west and north Oxfordshire but the beasts have rarely been seen as far south as Culham before. Its increased fears that they are expanding their range and breeding in new areas. Michael said he phoned Thames Valley Police and was interviewed by wildle experts in Wallingford. He said there were a large number of dog walkers in the area and he wanted to warn others of the potential of encountering dangerous wild animals.  Danny Bamping, who runs the British Big Cats Society which keeps track of sightings, said it was extremely rare to see two big cats together. He said the sighting was likely to be of a melanistic jaguar or leopard. They were released into the wild after keeping them as pets was made illegal in . He added: If there were two together it was either a couple who are breeding or a mother with her cubs. It is only a big catit has the capacity to roar -not, it is either a domestic cat or a hybrid. The lespan for these animals is about  years so were likely to be seeing the third or fourth generation. In April  a mum-of-two was nearly knocked down a black panther which strolled across the road in front of her car in north Oxfordshire. Lisa Londons terrying encounter with what she swears was a jungle puma happened on the main road through the village of Upper Arncott. Mrs London, , said she was driving from her home in Bicester to Oxford and had just passed through Upper Arncott, not far from Burford, at about .am when the beast, nearly ft tall, appeared. As I came out of the residential bit there were no other cars on the road, she said. You go down a country road and what I saw was maybe  yards in front of me - it essentially strolled across the road from the right to the left then leapt into the bushes. It looked like a black panther - it was shiny black and there was no way it was a dog or a deer or a domestic cat, it was too big. Mrs London estimated the creature was a metre tall and a metre-and-a-half long. It was jet black, and you just dont expect to see that on any other animal. It wasnt scary - it was beautul.  Mrs London had never even heard of the fabled Beast of Burford and it wasnt until she got home and told her husband about her close encounter that he remembered hearing similar stories. The pair went to Google and brought up newspaper stories about previous sightings of the legendary creature. Oxford resident Steve Archibald, who runs the website bigcatsightings, said at the time in April  it was not the first time he had heard reports of sightings in the Bicester area. But he had not heard of one for several years. A few months earlier he had received a call from Thames Valley Police to say a farmer near Chipping Norton reported he was in his tractor when he saw a big black cat running across his field with a muntjac deer in its mouth. Over the past ten years he has received something like  calls of Oxfordshire sightings in total. He said There definitely, definitely are big cats in Oxfordshire, but they are the most elusive animals on the planet. People who live with them in America might see paw prints and droppings but go their whole lives without seeing one. In Oxfordshire there is so much open space and woodland where they could hide. Theories behind how wild populations get established include escapes from sanctuaries or intentional releases by exotic animal owners, he said. Since  Thames Valley Police has been called to at least ten big cat sightings around Oxfordshire and neighbouring Berkshire and Buckinghamshire. In April , Connor Consyrag posted on social media I heard a story, a few months back, about several muntjac being found dead in the branches of trees. Panthers are known to kill their prey such as small deer and drag the carcases into the branches of trees to eat at their leisure. A spokesman from the British Big Cat Society said the UK has plenty of ideal countryside which is good hunting ground for panthers, cougars, leopards and even lions and tigers because there is lots of woodland for them to hide in and leap out on their prey. Escapees from private collections and small zoos are now living wild and have started families, he said. The only big black cat that would be seen in Britain was a melanistic leopard, commonly called a panther. The melanistic gene that makes the animal go black seems to be common when cats inter-breed. We know we have several dferent species so it is possible that the big black cats seen out there could be hybrid, so unique to science. Its not like believing in the Loch Ness monster. There is absolutely no doubt that they are out there. The most credible reports are from farmers, and those guys know their stuff. We have also had policemen reporting sightings to us. For every report, there are going to be others who dont report it. Many zoologists think Britain has a large wild population of big cats which have been breeding and forming colonies in remote areas of countryside since the late s. Thats when the Dangerous Wild Animals Act forced owners to get rid of exotic pets and they dumped them. The beasts have always been dismissed as the stuff of rural legend,creatures of fantasy, but a Natural England team declared these mysterious creatures do indeed exist. Their report - dubbed the X Files - revealed that of the -plus sightings since ,  were classed as big cats. In some cases, people said they had seen the creature itself, on other occasions they reported finding farm or wild animals which had been attacked or killed and partly-eaten. Natural England took it so seriously it launched several investigations over the last few years, involving site visits by experts and the drafting in of specialist vets to examine injuries.

title: corrie mckeagues mum vows find
story: NewsCorrie McKeagues mum vows to find mystery McDonalds Man herself - as she insists shes STILL looking for missing sonCorrie went missing in the early hours of September ,  in the Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk - police have said they believe his body is at a landfill site in CambridgeshireShareCommentsByElaine McCahill:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsCorrie McKeagues mum has vowed to find out the identity of the mysterious McDonalds man and will continue searching for her son "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailCorrie McKeagues mum has vowed to track down the mysterious McDonalds Man police have stopped looking for in the search for the missing airman - as she insisted she hasnt given up hope of finding her son. Nicola Urquharts comments come after Corries dad Martin accepted his sons body was caught up in Miltons waste disposal network and said the family will be holding a private memorial for him in the near future. But hours later the RAF airmans mother separately vowed to keep searching for her son who went missing on September  .Police said yesterday they believe Corrie fell asleep after climbing into a recycling bin and was crushed to death by a bin lorry before being transported to a landfill site  miles away in Milton, Cambridgeshire.Suffolk Police recently attended a meeting with Bfa, who confirmed the bin that was picked up from outside Greggs in the Horseshoe area of Bury St Edmunds weighed kg - much higher than bin collection weights from the same place normally.  After the tragic news was revealed, Corries dad shared an emotional Facebook post saying: my son is gone.But Corries mum Nicola has expressed her disappointment police took so long to eliminate McDonalds man - a man they released CCTV pictures of in March  entering the fast food restaurant - from their enquiries. The older man was pictured in the fast food chain just yards from where Corrie was last seen. He is the only person in the enquiry not to have been identied. Nicola said people had contacted her with information relating to the McDonalds man which she passed onto the police.  She wrote on Facebook: I do not know how long ago the police decided this person was no longer of interest and they dont want them identied. I do believe they have had no interest for over a year. I am going to try and find this person myself as the police obviously felt there was a reason to share the photo of this person and ask for help at one point. It feels to me that a reasonable thing to do was follow up on information provided. She added: We are still busy trying to find Corrie.  Suffolk and Norfolk police previously spent  days looking for Corrie at the Milton tip and trawled through more than , tonnes of rubbish. Corrie was last seen in the area of Bury St Edmunds known as the horseshoe where there was a bin lorry collection at around .am to .am on Saturday,  September, . Only one bin was collected from the area that morning. Waste from it was initially taken to a transfer station at Red Lodge and then to the Milton landfill site.  Milton landfill site is around , square metres. The original -week search for Corrie was stopped in July  after nothing was found. Officers searched through more than , tonnes of waste during this time, at a cost of pound.million. A further search started on October ,  and finished in December  at an estimated cost of pound,.  Police say despite a huge amount of publicity nationally and locally, there have been no confirmed sightings of Corrie after .am on September , . The police investigation into missing Corrie has cost pound.million to date, according to a Freedom of Information request ordered by the BBC. It makes the case one of the most expensive undertaken by a police force. Corries girlfriend April Oliver discovered she was pregnant with his baby two weeks after he went missing. She gave birth to a baby girl named Ellie-Louise in June last year.

story: NewsFamily horried after being served undercooked chicken balls at Chinese buffet restaurantLucy Gosling was on a family visit to the Oriental Touch restaurant in Torquay, Devon, when they made the grim discoveryShareCommentsByAbbie Bray:,  OCT NewsLucy and her family have promised to never step foot in the restaurant again"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA family received a nasty surprise while tucking into their chicken balls from a Chinese restaurant on Sunday. Mum-of-two Lucy Gosling went to Oriental Touch in Torquay, Devon, with family and friends when they discovered that the chicken they were eating from the buffet was pink inside.The -year-old said she felt sick to her stomach when she made the grim discovery, DevonLive reported .As my partner went to tuck into the chicken from the buffet he said at the time that it didnt taste right and when he opened it up, it was pink inside, she said.  I then went up to get a chicken ball for my son and as I was cutting it up for him I was disgusted to find that it was raw and bloody inside. We then cut open all of the chicken we had on our plates only to discover it was all uncooked. I was absolutely horried. Lucy said she and her family often enjoy a meal out at Oriental Touch and have never had any problems before. She added: We have been going there for more than eight years and we have never experienced anything like this before, I still cant believe that something like this has happened. I will never go there ever again. When we realised the chicken wasnt cooked we notied the manager straight away and he then went to check on the rest of the chicken at the buffet and he agreed that the chicken wasnt cooked properly. At first we thought he had removed all of the uncooked chicken so about half an hour later I went back up as they had brought fresh food out and when I cut it open, it was pink again inside. We tried calling the manager over again but he just completely ignored us, so my boyfriend went up to the bar and told them again and they still didnt remove the chicken.  I think the reason I am so angry about it, is because I have young children and there were more than  other people dining in the restaurant at the time and it seemed like the manager didnt care. Lucy described the whole incident as a complete nightmare and vows to never step foot in the restaurant again. She said: The manager admitted that the chicken was uncooked but he didnt seem to care. I am absolutely appalled that there was no customer service at all. Myself, my partner and my friends have all been extremely ill as a result of this and I just dont want them to think they can get away with doing something like this. Jason, the manager of Oriental Touch said: The customer who came in to our buffet restaurant on a Sunday afternoon while eating over an hour found a piece of chicken that was not fully cooked. The whole batch of chicken was immediately removed from the food court. We do apologise for the unfortunate incident that has happen. This have never happen before however in future we will be extra cautious. We do hold a hygiene rating of four star.

title: flamboyant businesswoman funded luxury lifestyle
story: NewsBusinesswoman funded £k mansion, Spanish villa and Aston Martin running £million legal high empirePaula White, , made over £m from a global crime operation which left one man dead and has been ordered to pay back more than £m ot risk jailShareCommentsByJon Harris:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsPaula White, , made over £m from a global crime operation "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA flamboyant businesswoman who lived a lestyle of champagne, designer clothing and fast cars by masterminding Britains biggest ever racket in former legal highs was ordered to repay pound.million. Wealthy former football and rugby league club director Paula White, , made over poundm from a global crime operation which left one man dead. Meanwhile she enjoyed the proceeds with her lesbian partner in a luxury pound, three-storey, detached home and a Spanish villa in Marbella. Police who investigated White discovered she used the profits of her online racket to buy a pound, Aston Martin, Ford Mustang and top of the range BMW convertible. She owned  properties across Salford and Manchester and was spending pound, to build an orangery and a swimming pool, as well as kennels for her dogs worth pound,.  Known simply as P to her foot soldiers - she also built a huge walk-in wardrobe with dressing room stuffed with the latest high end fashion items including pairs of Jimmy Choo shoes, and clothing by Alexander McQueen, Vivienne Westwood and Alexander Wang. She also wore a range of luxury jewellery including a Franck Muller watch worth pound, had Bang and Olufsen TVs littered around her six-bedroom property where she hosted VIP champagne and canape parties complete with a red carpet and guest list. In  White, a qualied accountant from Eccles, Greater Manchester, was jailed for nine years after she admitted conspiracy to supply class-B drugs between  and . Three years on she brought back before Carlisle Crown Court where she was ordered to pay back some of the money she made or face another eight years in jail.  The judge ruled she had made pound,, from her crimes and ordered her to repay pound,, at a confiscation hearing. The Crown Prosecution Service also obtained a court order freezing bank accounts White had set up in Tanzania to store her dirty money. White who ran a number of media and leisure firms was the former director of now defunct Chester City football club and ex-boss of Widnes Rugby League club. She began her racket from home in  and distribute the drugs, marked as medical items such as nasal sprays, through a post office in Eccles. The operation began to expand and by the end the year  parcels per day by special delivery and eventually moved to an industrial unit at Drake Mill in Farnworth. When the legal highs were banned in April  the gang continued selling them - claiming they were for research.  She employed her partner as her right hand woman and recruited another female friend to run day-to-day sales operations. She hired a designer to create the website. She purchased the machinery to mix the drugs at her HQ and even trained her staff in how to use it. But her crime empire crumbled after reveller Grant Wooldridge, , of Newbury died in July  after taking drugs ordered from the website whilst attending a music festival in Bath. He had mixed it with four other hallucinogenic and stimulant chemicals and told his girlfriend he was invincible before collapsing with seizures and cardiac arrest. Police eventually raided Whites home in May  during  swoops in which  people were arrested. They also closed down a number of websites linked to the racket. Inquiries revealed the chemicals were sourced in the Far East and mixed in the UK - with customers getting free t-shirts for sales.

story: NewsLondon apartment becomes UKs most expensive home after selling for £ MILLION to mystery buyerThe incredible apartment, located at the exclusive One Hyde Park in Knightsbridge, is described as a flat maisonette in Land Registry records, which show the transaction took place in MayShareCommentsByAbigail OLeary:,  OCT NewsOne Hyde Park in Knightbridge, London "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA London apartment has sold for a staggering pound MILLION - and the two-storey home offers a -metre pool, cinema and even a library. title: mum vowed never fat bridesmaid
story: NewsMum vowed never to be fat bridesmaid again after seeing this wedding photo - and just look at her nowHelen Wood, , from Blackburn, Lancashire, weighed  stone lb and said she "stuck out like a sore thumb" in every pictureShareCommentsByRosa McMahonSophie Halle-Richards:,  OCT NewsHelen as maid of honour at her best friends wedding "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAmazing photos show the transformation of an obese maid of honour who went on to shed  STONE after seeing her horric photo in her bridesmaid dress. Helen Wood, , was devastated when the  had to be added to the pale green satin gown just weeks before her best friends big day.Manchester Evening News reports that the business support officer, who works in the city, had to have the dress altered from a size  to  to ensure it fit her.Previously weighing  stone lb, the mum-of-two from Blackburn, said she stuck out like a sore thumb in every picture. When she saw the photos, Helen vowed never again to be a fat bridesmaid and slimmed down to an incredible size , now weighing just  stone.  It was horrendously embarrassing for me, watching my best friend get married and feeling like the fat bridesmaid, Helen said. “I stood out like a sore thumb in all the pictures, and when I actually saw the images taken I cried and cried.” Despite previously shting eight stone in  thanks to diet and exercise, Helen relapsed after meeting her husband, Matt and having two children. Admitting that she squeezed into size  clothes at her biggest, she recalled: “Matt was working in Manchester when we met, so I would stay over a lot and we’d go out for dinners, have drinks and le became really comfortable. “I’d lost the weight before by cutting out the rubbish and exercising every day, but I gave all that up when I met Matt and we fell in love.” Skipping breakfast, Helen would snack on crisps, before having a cheese and ham sandwich with a chocolate bar for pudding at lunch and a double portioned pasta meal, slathered in creamy tomato sauce for dinner. But her real downfall was her nightly ritual of a family-size bar of chocolate with a cup of tea in bed. Gorging on , calories a day and never exercising, after giving birth to Jack in  she made no effort to sht the “baby weight. Then, after having Emilie in July , Helen soared to a hefty size . But with her best friend, Kelly, , due to marry that October and with a size  dress bought for the occasion, Helen panicked.  “I was so touched when my childhood friend Kelly asked me to be her maid of honour, and with just three months to go until the big day, I was determined to get into the gown, but deep down knew I wouldn’t,” she said. “With a new baby and a toddler, I struggled to find the time to concentrate on my weight so, before I knew it, the wedding was weeks away and I was still fat.” Knowing the dress would never fit, she visited a tailor, asking her to make it bigger by adding  into the sides, so she could wear it. She said: “I looked dferent to everyone  and really stood out. Another bridesmaid was pregnant at the time and I actually looked bigger than she did. “The dress wasn’t the same as everyone ’s because of the alterations and I felt larger than I ever had. “I made Matt delete all the photos he took of me and cried my eyes out.” Vowing to change, it took Helen seven months to summon the courage to contact the weight loss company, Cambridge Weight Plan. “My mum suggested I gave it a go, as they offer one to-one support and create a personalised plan,” she said.  “I couldn’t face going to slimming classes and being with lots of people I didn’t know.” In her first two weeks, Helen lost lb by eating and drinking only the Cambridge Weight Plan products, before slowly incorporating exercise into her regime, too. Now,  months on, she has even become a Cambridge Weight Plan consultant and has never felt better. “I’ve got a split-picture on my phone background - one photo is of me now and one is me at my largest. When I showed my little boy, he didn’t know who the larger woman was,” she smiled.

title: princess eugenie royal wedding how
story: NewsEugenie royal wedding: Bride and fiance Jack Brooksbank are related to same slave traderThe couple, who will wed at Windsor Castle on Friday, are related to slave-trafficker Edward Lascelles from the th centuryShareCommentsByElaine McCahill:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsPrincess Eugenie and fiance Jack Brooksbank are actually related"Get Royal Family updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailPrincess Eugenie and her husband-to-be Jack Brooksbank are actually related as they can both trace their ancestry to an th century slave-trafficker.The couple will wed at Windsor Castle on Friday but their nuptials continue to hit the headlines as the Daily Mirror revealed today that homeless people are being told to move on from the carriage route.Their lavish ceremony will have more guests that Prince Harrys wedding to Meghan Markle with  expected to attend the big day. Eugenies wedding is going to cost tax payers in the region of pound.million for policing and security around Windsor.  And just days before the second royal wedding of the year, it has emerged the lovebirds are in fact related to each other.They share an ancestor in Edward Lascelles, a slave trading conman who made an endless fortune buying and selling men and women from Africa, reports the Daily Mail .He was known for locking them up on the so-called factory ships for months on end before they were sold in the New World. Many died on the perilous journey from Africa to Barbados, and others were slain when they rose against their savage treatment. Lascelles is the couples seven-times grandfather and his grandchildrens lineage continues to this day.  His grandaughter, Lady Mary Ann Lascelles, married Richard York and Jack is descended from this union. Eugenies mother, Sarah Ferguson, the Duchess of York, is descended from the slave traders grandson Henry, the Earl of Harewood. Lascelles, and his half-brother Henry, expanded their fortune by stealing money from the government and charging huge interest rates as money lenders. They also amassed huge sums from replenishing British naval ships in the Caribbean.  By , Henry, Viscount Lascelles, proposed to Princess Mary, Queen Elizabeths aunt and a direct link to the House of Windsor was established. Meanwhile, in the lead up to their big day the couple and their families have shared cute childhood snaps and more recent snaps from their private photo album. Theres also a photo of the couple looking very loved up on New Years Eve in Verbier, just weeks before they announced their engagement.Jack asked Eugenie to be his we while they were on holiday in holiday in Nicaragua , and they announced the news in January. The couple are hosting a two-day wedding celebration, and will tie the knot in St Georges Chapel in Windsor Castle on Friday. story: NewsStorm Callum: Met Office issues NEW weather warnings for millions across UK of mph winds and heavy rain"Danger to le" warnings are in place as the Atlantic storm threatens to disrupt travel, cut power and flood roadsShareCommentsByChris kitching:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video watch-latest-uk-weather-forecast-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe Met Office has issued new weather warnings as the UK braces for potentially deadly Storm Callum with mph winds and mm of rain. A danger to le warning for wind has been extended and new warnings for rain are in place over Friday and Saturday. The weather is likely to be so severe the Met Office has named it Storm Callum to encourage people to take the warnings seriously. The Atlantic storm threatens to disrupt travel for commuters and holidaymakers, cut power, flood roads and put lives at risk due to flying debris and falling trees.  Strong winds with mph gusts are expected to lash Northern Ireland, western parts of Scotland and north-west England all day on Friday. It will be a two-day rain event, with up to mm possible across some places in Wales, western Scotland, northern England and the Yorkshire and Humber regions by midnight Saturday. The storm is due to hit just days after Britain basks in what could be the hottest October day in years on Wednesday. Where will the storm hit  The wind warning is in place from am to .pm on Friday for the following areas: Northern Ireland: All counties. Scotland: Central, Tayside and Fe, Highlands and Eilean Siar, South West and Lothian Borders, Strathclyde.  England: North West England. The Met Office warned: Gusts  to mph are likely in some places, with potential for gusts of  to mph around exposed coasts and hills. High tides are also near their peak, heightening the risk of coastal impacts due to large waves. There is a chance of gusts over mph in the Western Isles during the afternoon and evening. The strongest winds are expected across eastern areas of Northern Ireland during the early morning followed by Scotland from late morning onward. Where will heavy rain fall   There are two separate warnings for rain - one covering Friday and one for Saturday. Fridays warning covers Wales, North West England and Yorkshire and Humber from am to .pm. The Met Office says: A zone of heavy rain associated with an intense weather system affecting western parts of the UK will become slow moving for a time, bringing prolonged rainfall and the potential for surface water flooding. Areas of high ground exposed to the south and south west will be most affected, with the potential for over mm of rain in  hours in the most exposed locations, and over  mm by the end of the day. The rain is expected to be accompanied by strong winds, which when combined with high tides may lead to some coastal impacts due to large waves. In addition, these winds may increase autumnal leaf fall, which would increase the potential for blocked drains and culverts, heightening the flooding risk.  Saturdays rain warning affects the following areas all day long: Wales: Entire country. Scotland: Central, Tayside and Fe, Grampian, Highlands and Eilean Siar, SW and Lothian Borders, Strathclyde. England: North East and North West. The Met Office said: The zone of heavy rain affecting England and Wales on Friday is expected to slowly move northwards on Saturday, with the focus of heaviest rainfall slowly moving away from south Wales but increasingly into parts of Scotland. Areas of high ground exposed to the south and south west will be most affected, with the potential for -mm in  hours, and a chance of over  mm in a few spots by the end of the event. The rain is expected to be accompanied by strong winds, which may increase autumnal leaf fall and potential for blocked drains culverts, heightening the potential for flooding. What is this weeks forecast   Here is the short-term forecast from the Met Office: Wednesday: Early mist and fog patches may linger through the morning in some areas, but once they have cleared it will be a dry and sunny day across the UK. It will be fairly breezy, but feeling warm in the sunshine. Temperatures will be in the low to mid s in the south. Wednesday night: Some heavy showers are expected in the southwest during the evening, affecting other areas through the night. Otherwise a mainly dry night with some cloud and hill fog. Thursday: A mixture of cloud and sunny spells for most, and feeling warm. However, heavy showers are expected in the west, with strong blustery winds and a risk of thunder. Outlook for Friday to Sunday: Strong winds and heavy rain at times on Friday and Saturday, especially in the west with gales or severe gales. On Sunday the rain will clear, with sunny spells after.

story: Advertorial things students dont realise they need when heading to universityComplete this check list and youll be off to a first class start to your courseShareByDave Masters:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT AdvertorialTheres so much to remember when heading off to university"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTheres a hell of a lot to sort out when you start university. title: grieving bride dons wedding dress
story: NewsGrieving bride in wedding dress sobs on grave of dead fiancé on day they were supposed to marryBrave Jessica Padgett says her wedding day was special - even though she didnt get to marry the man of her dreams after firefighter Kendall was killed by an alleged drunk driverShareCommentsBySophie Evans:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsBrave Jessica Padget kneels beside her fiancé Kendall Murphys grave on what should have been their wedding day "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailDressed in a flowing white wedding dress, Jessica Padgett bows her head as she kneels at her fianceacutes grave on the day they were meant to tie the knot. This heartbreakingly beautul picture was captured on September , when Jessica was supposed to marry the man of her dreams, Kendall Murphy. The couple tragically never got the chance to wed after firefighter Kendall, , was hit and killed by an alleged drunk driver in November last year. But on what should have been their big day,  months after the tragedy, Jessica bravely wore her bridal gown and marked the date herself.  With her hair and makeup done, the courageous bride was pictured holding a bouquet of flowers as she paid an emotional visit to Kendalls headstone. She tearfully knelt beside the grave, with her head resting on her hands, before being joined by other loved ones, who knelt down beside her. “I wanted to be where he was at,” Jessica said. The bride, who made broken look beautul and strong look invincible, also honoured her beloved fianceacute in other ways on their wedding day. In powerful images, taken by Loving Le Photography in Indiana, US, she smiles beside Kendalls firefighter gear and gazes at a picture of him.  She also embraces loved ones, and later releases lanterns into the sky. And in one particularly striking shot from the day, she can be seen looking down at Kendalls boots, with his image photoshopped next to her. The late firefighter had worn the boots every day. Taking to Facebook the following morning, Jessica said her wedding day was special, even though I didn’t get to marry the man of my dreams. She wrote: I can’t say thank you to everyone enough for this entire week! I feel beyond spoiled and loved. This week wasn’t the outcome I wanted, but everyone made me feel especially loved.  I especially want to thank my sister for being my rock throughout everything, through the tears and the late night talks I couldn’t have done this without you. Thank you everyone for making my wedding day special even though I didn’t get to marry the man of my dreams. The wedding pictures, shared on Loving Le Photographys Facebook page, also feature Kendalls young nieces and nephews. One of them he sadly never got the chance to meet, Global News reports. Both Jessicas maid of honour and her fianceacutes best man are thought to have given speeches during the very emotional day.  Kendall, a volunteer firefighter from Montgomery, Indiana, was responding to a crash on a rural road when he was killed on November , . Police said he was pronounced dead at the scene after another firefighter responding to the incident, Colby Blake, , struck him with his truck. Blake was said to be driving with a . per cent blood alcohol level. He was arrested and charged over the incident, according to local media. The case is yet to be set for trial.

story: NewsTeacher frustrated by Brett Kavanaugh case comes up with brilliant way to educate children about consentElementary teacher Liz Kleinrock has shared her method for teaching youngsters about consentShareCommentsByCourtney PochinAudience Writer:,  OCT NewsTeachers simple way of educating children about consent has gone viral online"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email With the numerous stories that came out of the Me Too movement and the recent Kavanaugh case which shocked the world, it seems consent has been the word on everyones lips of late.Its an incredibly simple concept - whether or not someone agrees to do something, or have something done to them. Though its clear that some people are still unable to grasp just what it means.But one group of eight to nine-year-olds in the US are having no problem understanding what consent is, thanks to elementary school teacher Liz Kleinrock and the brilliant method she has come up with to educate youngsters.In a post on Instagram , Kleinrock, who works at Citizens of the World Charter School in Los Angeles, shared a look at just how she does it.The teacher and her students created a chart working through what it means to give consent, what consent sounds like and when you need to ask for consent in everyday le. She also covered the awkward grey areas surrounding consent such as whata person says no but theyre smiling and whatyou really want a hug but the other person doesnt. Kleinrock captioned the post: Everything about Kavanaugh in the news has been making me HEATED. So whenever I get frustrated about the state of our country, it inspires me to proactively teach my kids to DO BETTER.  Today was all about CONSENT. We even explored the grey areas, likesomeone says yes but their tone and body language really says no. Role playing is a great way to reinforce these skills, but they MUST be taught explicitly! Thousands of people have liked the photo and praised Liz for educating the children on such an important issue. One said: This is amazing and would love for this to be a school wide practice! A second commented: Love this!! You’re an amazing teacher!

story: NewsBoy, , spends  hours wandering motorway alone after whole family wiped out in horric car crashHeartbreaking images show Benjamin Monare with an oversize jacket draped over his shoulders moments after he was found after the crash in Minas Gerais, BrazilShareCommentsByJanet Tappin Coelho:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news world-news video boy--found-wandering-motorway-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA six-year-old boy spent  hours wandering alone on a busy motorway after his entire family was killed in a horric road crash. Heartbreaking images show Benjamin Monare sitting forlornly with an oversize jacket draped over his shoulders by the motorist who found him. The lone crash survivor was suffering from severe dehydration and was so traumatised he could barely speak and couldn’t remember his name or age. His parents Alessandro, , and Belkis, , and brother Samuel, aged eight, were all found dead in the familys car, which was found in a ditch in Minas Gerais, Brazil. The family were ing home after celebrating Mrs Monare’s birthday.  It’s believed the bewildered youngster was initially trapped in the wreck but managed to break free and scaled the banks of the gully where the car had plummeted on Sunday morning. He wasnt found until Tuesday morning. Preliminary investigations suggest the car was hit side on and catapulted off the road by another vehicle that failed to stop.  Dense vegetation kept the accident hidden for two days from passing traffic on the BR- motorway. The child miraculously escaped the carnage with only cuts and bruises, surviving on his own in the dark and without food or water. Devastated family members have been comforting the boy as he comes to terms with being an orphan. The youngster told rescuers he remembered the car falling down but couldn’t recall anything after that except when he got out and climbed the mountain.  Emergency rescuers used drones to search after worried relatives reported the family missing when they failed tohome at the expected time. The car was last seen on motorway cameras passing a state police checkpoint just after am. It should have gone through a toll booth further down the route but never arrived. Highway police and fire crew checked ious points along the stretch where they believed the car had gone missing but without success. Relatives also joined the hunt on Monday, using two cars to retrace the family’s journey as they desperately looked for clues to their whereabouts. Rescuers were about to launch aerial searches on Tuesday when the child appeared at the side of the road.  The tragic family, from Campinas in Sao Paulo state, were ing from a four-day break at a hot springs resort in Goias where they had been celebrating Mrs Monare’s birthday when the accident happened around :am. Mr Monare, a Baptist minister, told friends they would be back in the afternoon to vote in Brazil’s general elections. He was also expected to give a sermon at pm. The schoolboy’s aunt, Berenice Landim, , told local media: “The family left Caldas Novas on Sunday around :am and they were expected home in the afternoon. We were constantly in touch but when they didn’tour calls we started to get worried. “We alerted the police and shared our concerns on social media pleading for help and for any sightings of their car.”  She said her nephew is still in a state of shock and doesn’t fully understand what has happened yet. Tearful church members joined devastated friends and relatives at the Vista Alegre Baptist Church, to pay tribute to the family who had been involved in the community for six years. The aunt said: “This is a painful time for us, but we have to trust in God because he is the only one who knows why this has happened. “We believe our lives are fleeting and Benjamin’s le was spared for a purpose. We can only pray that God gives us the strength to care for him and comforts us through this dficult time. Because losing our loved ones in this way is very hard.” The young survivor is being kept in Uberlandia Federal University Clinical Hospital and monitored following a series of tests and exams. Doctors said his health is stable. Traffic cops have launched an investigation into the cause of the accident.

title: doctor removes nine teeth five
story: NewsBoy, , has nine teeth removed from his BRAIN after they grew on undetected tumourWARNING - GRAPHIC CONTENT: Doctors at the Zhejiang Medical University in Hangzhou, China, operated the young boy after he complained of headachesShareCommentsByNeil MurphyScott Feng:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsDoctor Shen Zhipeng holding the bag of teeth "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA doctor removed nine teeth from a little boys BRAIN after the bony structures formed in a rare tumour that went undetected since his birth.The five-year-olds parents took him to hospital after he fell over, began vomiting and complaining of headaches .Scans revealed hydrocephalus - water on the brain - as well as high-density objects near his brainstem.Dr Shen Zhipeng, of the Childrens Hospital of Zhejiang Medical University in eastern China, performed an MRI, which revealed a bluster of bony objects in his brain.In a craniotomy that lasted up to six hours, Dr Shen removed nine teeth from the boys brain and later diagnosed him with a germ cell tumour known as a teratoma.  The tumour can be either mature and benign or immature and cancerous. The boys was the former, which often contains tissue such as bone, muscle or hair. Dr Shen said: The human brain is delicate like tofu, even more so when its a childs. It was like picking bones out of a raw egg. It was a very complicated surgery. Everyone is aware that leukaemia is the most common cancer found in children, but what people dont know is that central nervous system tumours are the second-most frequent. Of central nervous system tumours, teratomas are uncommon and found only about  percent of the time. Mature teratomas make up about  percent of that figure.  Theyre very dficult to spot early on, but when discovered, the patient is often suffering from serious hydrocephalus. When a child begins exhibiting symptoms such as headaches and vomiting, most parents first reaction is to turn to internal medicine or gastroenterology - but it is actually caused by a brain tumour. Dr Shen says parents should consider brain scanstheir children continue to vomit for up to four weeks.

story: NewsWeatherwoman wears one-year-old toddler on back during TV forecast leaving viewers stunnedMum Susie Martin wanted to highlight International Babywearing Week while getting on with her jobShareCommentsByKelly-Ann Mills:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror incoming video weather-woman-stuns-viewers-wearing-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA weatherwoman has stunned her audience by wearing her toddler on her back as she read the forecast on American television. Mum Susie Martin wanted to highlight International Babywearing Week while getting on with her job presenting the forecast. She started the segment with a little explanation, as her one-year-old son did a huge yawn before dropping off to sleep in his comfy seat. Ms Martin, who is director of operations at weather company Praedictix, said: It is International Babywearing Week, so I thought Id bring out my handy assistant. As she went on through the changing weather, her little boy snuggled in to his mothers neck as she happily carried on working.  Speaking later to Good Morning America, Ms Martin said: I wanted to promote this wonderful tool thats helped me as a mum and the bonding experience between mother and son. I suppose its a way for the baby to be comforted. It was nice for me personally because I could multitask while comforting my child.The footage was later shared on Facebook and received more than .million views and thousands of comments.Ms Martin said she wa happy to see the footage was shared so widely. It does make me feel like a mom that can be very capable of doing things. Thats just the message that I love about it and I would say as a working mom, its nice to be able to have this tool with me to help me do my job. Dr Jason Homme, assistant professor of pediatrics at Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota, told ABC News the key, initial phase of parent-child bonding is during the first few weeks of le, but theres more connecting that occurs a little later in childhood, as with Martins son.  I think its reasonable to conclude that it can help with bonding for both for the parent and child, Homme told Good Morning America of baby-wearing. I think to promote it in this way is creative. Homme said mothers and fathers shouldnt consider it a lesser style of parenting to use a stroller, or any other dferent carrier. Im strongly pro-bonding and pro-mum...and mum getting it done at work, he added.*International Babywearing Week took place from October  to .

title: dog owners urged to lend their pets in bid to lead dundee addicts on road to recovery
story: Dog owners in Dundee are being asked to share their pets with the city’s drug addicts and rough sleepers in a bid to inspire more compassion from passers-by.Ric May and Stef Ollandini, both , believe man’s best friend could help bridge the gap between vulnerable people and the rest of society.For the past month Ric has been taking his own dog Wolfy, a white German shepherd Siberian husky cross, out on to the streets to meet homeless people.He even leaves Wolfy with some of the beggars for a couple of hours at a time, which he claims has an effect on how they are treated by other people.Ric said: “It might seem like a very simple thing, but the bottom line is when he sits with them it has an effect on loads of people who wouldn’t normally go near them.“It’s almost like Wolfy is an invitation for lots of animal lovers to come and get to know them and get to know people they wouldn’t normally speak to.”Ric said he has no reservations in leaving his beloved dog with heroin users.He said the drug problem was “systemic” in the city, but added: “If people could raise the level of compassion towards them, that would be the real answer.”Ric and Stef are now calling for other people to follow the example and spend more time getting to know the people they walk past every day.Stef said: “Wolfy is able to act as an antenna for people who would just walk past the vulnerable in another instance.“Instead they come down and talk to them. All are welcome. It’s not just people with dogs we need, its people who have compassion.”One woman who has benefited from having Wolfy sit with her is heroin addict Karen.Karen, , has been using the drug for  years and uses three times a day.She said she noticed an increase in the number of people speaking to her when she had Wolfy by her side.“It just makes a dference with the dog,” Karen said.“There are a lot more people who stop and speak to you.”

title: dundee fans group writes to top officials over referee steven mcleans links to kilmarnock
story: Angry Dundee fans have written to two top refereeing officials over whistler Steven McLean being put in charge of Saturday’s controversial clash with Kilmarnock despite having strong family connections with the Ayrshire club.McLean blundered by awarding the second-half penalty that saw Killie take the three points from the Dens Park clash.And supporters with long memories are unhappy he was handling the proceedings despite his father, Stewart, making over  appearances for the Rugby Parkers between  and .To add to the conspiracy theories, for  years he was a team-mate of Paul Clarke – brother of their current boss Steve.The pair even appeared on the same sticker in an edition of the annual Panini football album.All that’s prompted the Dundee Supporters’ Association to write to SFA head of referees’ committee chairman Willie Young and their head of refereeing, John Fleming, to question the sense behind having McLean taking games involving Kilmarnock.“Several of our members have contacted me to express their concerns over this and we think it’s only right to pass them on to the authorities,” said DSA chairman Kenny Ross.“And I do think there is reason to question the validity of this appointment when the referee so clearly has family connections to Kilmarnock.“If nothing  it puts him in a dficult position when you get a decision like Saturday’s.“I know that Steven McLean’s brother Brian played for Dundee United, Ross County and a few other clubs and he was not allowed to take charge of games involving teams he was at.“You think the same common sense approach could have e-mailed and has promised a response will be given.
